wikipedia_page.main: Simon Timothy Smith (born 1960) is a rugby union international who represented England between 1985 and 1986.

response: In the same era, a young Roger Uttley, subsequently to skipper and then manage England, and Brian Ashton, England's Head Coach, also played for Fylde. Other more recent internationals associated with Fylde include England wingers Tony Swift and Simon Smith, who were capped in the 1980s after leaving the club and locks Steve Bainbridge and Wade Dooley, established internationals who won further caps whilst with Fylde.
* Simon Smith (rugby union), Cambridge University, Wasps RUFC & England Rigby Union

link_mentions.page: List of England national rugby union players

response: His father Simon Smith played for Wasps and gained 9 caps for England between 1985 and 1986. His mother rowed for Cambridge and Great Britain.
*Simon Smith (drummer), drummer in several British indie rock bands
*Simon Smith (footballer), former footballer and now goalkeeping coach
*"Simon Smith and the Amazing Dancing Bear", a 1967 song
*Simon Smith (diplomat) (born 1958), British Ambassador to South Korea and formerly Ukraine and Austria
